1.content: 'Thats just things parents say to scare us in to not going to far from home.' Marhak replied before he tuned back towards the woods and disappeared beyond the first line of trees.
1.title: Marhak enters the wood

choices: Hensar just manages to catch a glimpse of Marhak before he disappears again...
Hensar finds the ball but no sign of Marhak, she continues toward an odd noise.
Hensar catches up with Marhak and they discover something very strange.
11.content:
Hensar hesitated for only a moment before deciding to follow her brother. She felt particularly close to her only sibling, Marhak, especially since they were the last remaining children living in Dankar. Shamil, their cousin, had disappeared just a few months earlier. Their parents and the elders had pulled Hensar and Marhak aside one morning to question them about his whereabouts. They’d obviously hoped he was playing a trick on them and was hiding somewhere in the village. It wouldn’t have been the first time: Shamil loved to play practical jokes - even the Chief hadn’t been immune from their cousin’s antics the day he put Succir weed in the old man’s pipe - but this time was different. They’d all sensed that something terrible had happened. There was a strange quality to the air that day. It seemed somehow denser and had what one could only describe as the vile stench of evil.

Hensar was more scared of never seeing Marhak again than she was for her own safety. She stepped beyond the permissible zone and into the thick woods after him...
11.title: Hensar follows

choices: Stay in the light of the clearing
Head back the way they came
Investigate the noise in the bushes
113.content: Hensar reached Marhak as they entered the clearing. She saw him stop and bend downwards as if investigating something on the forest floor below. The wind whistled through the branches around and far away to the left she could hear footsteps lightly crunching fallen leaves. She reached Marhak and he displayed his discovery. In his hand he held a rucksack. It was her brothers. A low growl came from behind the trees to their left. She looked at Marhak and held his hand. What should they do now....
113.title: Hensar catches up with Marhak and they discover...

choices: Investigate the contents of the backpack
1131.content: As Hensar and Marhak cling to each other in the middle of the clearing the solitary growl in front of them becomes two then three. Behind them a noise of footsteps come form the undergrowth. It stops a squickly as it started. Then as the growling dies down Hensar hears something sniff the cold winter air
1131.title: Stay in the light of the clearing

choices: Hensar searches for her mother in the house
Hensar runs back into the forest to see what is wrong
Hensar visits her mothers neighbour in the hope of obtaining help
12.content:
Hensar arrived at the house five minutes later. Her mother had left the comfort of the rocking chair on the porch and it seemed that she had ventured back inside the house momentarily. Hensar ran up the path shouting her but no answer came from inside. When she reached the porch she saw the front door was swinging open in the wind and the glass that once held her mothers homemade lemonade was smashed on the floor, the lemonade itself disappearing fast in the crack between the wooden floorboards. She shouted her mother once more but still there was no reply. Maybe she was asleep? Maybe she had gone next door? Maybe even to the village? Hensar didnt think this was likely as it wasnt like her mother to leave the house so unsecure.

Then all thoughts of her mother were quickly removed from her mind. Behind her back in the woods she heard Marhak scream....
12.title: Hensar runnes home to tell her mother

choices: Hensar searches the house from top to bottom
121.content: After hearing her brothers cry she knew he was in trouble. She ran into the hall screaming for her mother. The front room was empty the only sign of anyone having been in it being the fire that was smouldering underneath the mantle. The same was true in the dining room. Her mothers knitting lay cast aside on the floor beneath the chair were she usually resided. Other than that nothing....
121.title: Hensar searches for her mother in the house

choices: use her phone to call for help
persuade Marhak to go into the woods with her to investigate
13.content: Hensar turned to run. The scream came from somewhere far ahead of them but, in the silence of the evening, it echoed across the valley. Her thoughts immediately turned to her missing brother. Something told her inside that it was him, something told her he was fighting for his life. Marhak, by her side seemed stuck to the spot. Some older brother he was. It would have to be her, she would have to make the decision. Another scream ran across the valley this time a little further away. The time to make a decision was upon her...
13.title: Hensar hears a loud screem and runs for her life
